website_summaries.verdict: The Saucony Echelon LE2 became a go-to walking shoe for a significant number of people. It was highly praised for its cushioning and support which made the footwear suitable for long periods of wear. On the downside, there were complaints about durability, insufficient upper support, high price, and unappealing style. But all things considered, it was still the footgear of choice for the majority of buyers who enjoyed the effortless and painless walking experience.
pros: The Saucony Echelon LE2 was able to deliver a pleasant walking experience to a great number of wearers
A lot of buyers appreciated the midsole cushioning
some people mentioned that it helped to relieve pain in their feet, knees, and back
The shoe allowed for orthotic inserts without sacrificing the fit, based on many reviews
Most testers found that the footwear was true to size and width
A few people were happy that the trainer corrected supination
Several reviewers mentioned that the product appeared to be well-constructed
cons: A handful of people complained about the lack of support in the upper, which resulted in the foot sliding off the outside edge of the sole
The rubber came peeling off the toes after a few months of use, according to several users
The shoe was deemed pricey by some purchasers
The style and color options did not resonate well with a few customers

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME SHOE FOR WORK
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME SHOE I'M A MALE DIABETIC AND THERE IS ONLY CERTAIN SHOES THAT I CAN WEAR AND SAUCONY IS ONE OF MY GO TO SHOES FOR WORK CAUSE THEY ARE ALL BLACK AND THAT'S PART OF MY COMPANY'S POLICY IS TO HAVE ALL BLACK SHOES.I HAVE ABOUT 7 PAIR OF SAUCONY SHOES IN ALL DIFFERENT MODELS AND COLORS AND THIS IS ONE OF MY FAVORITE PAIR TO WEAR.THE ONLY THING I WISH THEY HAD IS A BOOT STYLE.I WALK ON CONCERT 10 TO 12 HOURS A DAY AS I WORK IN A PARTS STORE AND I HAVE OTHER SHOES AND BOOTS BUT TO ME THESE ARE ALMOST AS GOOD AS MY HOKA ONE ONE BOOTS
customer_reviews.author: 13RWD

customer_reviews.title: I love Saucony shoes for a long time because of being ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Saucony shoes for a long time because of being lightweight and very comfortable to wear!! This is the first time I bought a walking shoe and normally I wear a size 10XW but I ordered a 11W. It is a bit snug but I guess I have to allow for stretching so I will have to really use it to see how it goes. But other than that, it is a good shoe. Maybe next time I will have to order 1 1/2 to 2 sizes bigger. But we will see.
customer_reviews.author: leadpipefitter

customer_reviews.title: Did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically for work because I do a lot of walking and standing during my 10 hour shift and my last pair of work shoes killed my feet. I've bought saucony brand shoes in the past and they were very comfortable so I figured these walking shoes should be the same and after a work week of wearing them, I am not disappointed. Also, these are the first "wide" size 13s I've ever bought and I've been to think that I should've been buying wide my whole life because these shoes feel great.
customer_reviews.author: Bsu

customer_reviews.title: A Great Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I owned the original LE and wore those out. Purchased the LE 2 6 months ago and actually like them better. These shoes are very comfortable and wear very well. I walk 3 or 4 miles a day and currently weigh 230 lbs. I have walked for years and these are by far the best shoes I have purchased. Be advised though, that you should buy a half size larger. I wear a 12 street shoe and the 12.5 fits perfectly with no cramping in the toe area while not being too loose. They are somewhat pricey but as with everything you get what you pay for. A definite recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M.

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very soft and comfy right out of the box. Glove soft leather. Feels high quality. Got 12 2E. Wide enough and feel immediately comfortable. I got the white pair and look a little too white but I'll put black or gray laces on them and they will look great. I would probably get the black ones next time. The white ones were on a great sale price so I had to try them. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: LOVE AMAZON

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased 6 pairs of these shoes. Excellent for walking. I walk over 1,200 miles per year and get about 700-800 miles on a pair of these shoes before I need to replace them. Another very good shoe for walking is the Brooks Addition Walker, but quite a bit more expensive. I wore through 8 pairs of Addition Walkers before switching to the Saucony Echelon LE2. Not only is the Echelon LE2 less in price, I like them better.
customer_reviews.author: NLEnds

customer_reviews.title: very good shoes
customer_reviews.text: When the doctor said to stop buying cheap shoes and to start getting shoes with proper arch support that fit properly, I picked these up. I'm glad I did. They are durable and check all the boxes for what I need from a pair of shoes. I wish there were more choices than just all-black or all-white though.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: Not HAPPY at All!
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this shoe, but for some reason no body carries it anymore. I really wanted it in black, but in my size it's impossible to get anywhere. It's like someone bought all the inventory. I have bad knees, feet, and a pinched nerve in my foot. These shoes gave the right support and were light to wear for walking and working all day. I can't even buy them from the Saucony website. I'm a very unhappy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kovalick Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit for this heavy man
customer_reviews.text: Found an article online about shoes for the big man and this was one of the recommended shoes. Love the comfort and arch support. Using without any orthopedic device and it's truly amazing. Hoping it lasts for a while! Next to the basic Kirkland White cheapos, this will be my go to shoe for daily activity.
customer_reviews.author: Majkboy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable yet supportive shoes!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been wearing New Balance 608 shoes but lately the just don't fit and last like they used to. He has trouble with his knees and back and when his shoes are not right, he gets pain if he wears them for any length of time. These shoes are doing the trick so far. He's happy so I am happy. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Gail B

customer_reviews.title: Good Light Weight Walking Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are comfortable even while wearing support hose during walking. They are new and a little snug but hoping they will relax a little like the Omni shoe which are now 10 months old and are no longer in inventory. The Echelon is lighter than the Omni but has a rounder toe box. Actually I liked the Omni sporty look better the reason for 4 stars. Hope these lighter weight shoes wear as well as the Omni shoe. Price also is cheaper than the Omni so if they wear just as well then they are worth the cost and the change of style.
customer_reviews.author: Oldsoldier22

customer_reviews.title: The Echelon LE2 shoes are comfortable and have helped ease knee pain caused by my ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Saucony Echelon LE2 Walking Shoes. I wore the first pair daily for more than a year before this new pair. The Echelon LE2 shoes are comfortable and have helped ease knee pain caused by my underpronation (supination) issues. As for quality I have found the shoe to be well made. After more than a year of daily wear the my pair of LE2's showed little significant wear on the sole and the uppers were still in good condition. I am confident you will be pleased with this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are relatively comfortable, and after a week of wear, they don't squeak at all. I hope that continues to be the case. I don't know if its a fit problem or not, but the right shoe lists to the right ever so slightly, hence the downgrade of one star. They are light weight so pretty good so far.
customer_reviews.author: M. Haymond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for postal carrier
customer_reviews.text: My husband, a postal carrier, is currently on his third pair of these this year. He walks up to 30 miles a day and he has never had a single blister or foot pain! If you can’t find a comfortable shoe that actually fits, give these a try.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My third pair ~ these are my "go to" shoes for working on concrete and steel...
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of this walking shoe, with the last two being this version. I wanted to see what a half size larger would be, if I were to use it while hiking. It works better that my Saucony running shoes that have more cushion on concrete. These are my "go to" shoes. I use them daily at work. If you're on your feet all day like I am...traverse stairs that are concrete and steel frequently, then these are the work shoe for you.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Quality for the big guy
customer_reviews.text: Heard these were good for big guys. I’m 6’7’’ over 325# seems great the last week. Width of the front of shoe is a little snug for me but I expect will be perfect after breaking them in.

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and light perfect go all day wearing
customer_reviews.text: As always fit perfect The only issue is the laces they are much too long so I have to buy 45 inch laces because the laces that come with are 52 inch so have to spend $2.00 and have the correct laces in

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Bought my husband I both this shoe for our 2 mile walks every morning. We both LOVE these shoes. Agree with some other reviewers who have said they're like walking on a cloud.

customer_reviews.text: I experienced that walking shoes are for walking, not jogging shoes. They were tight but I was determined to break them in. Each time I use them the comfort level increases. So far so good.

customer_reviews.title: and I'm very satisfied with this pair
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of leather walking shoes in this style, and I'm very satisfied with this pair. I where my leather walking shoes to work and where them all day except for when I have a meeting. I wear my older pairs of the regular model to workout. Great Shoe.

I wanted these for winter thinking would warmer than the 5s because they are mesh. Unfortunately, the LE2s are too tight! Sadly I had to return them.

I'm couldent be more happy with the comfort they give me and l would suggest them to anyone with high arch issues. A exelent shoe

Good value for the money and leather uppers. Breaking them in now. Saucony used to make the Hyde bowling shoe. Another good product.

The product looks and feels cheap now , the previous models were made with quality materials . Very sad that saucony has done this .

They are light, stable, and feel right while striding. I wear blisters on the outer edge of my big toe, but do that in many other shoes. I can recommend these for any serious walker.

customer_reviews.text: Saucony has been my preferred running shoe for many years. Of all the running shoe brands I tried, these always felt like they were custom made for my feet. I needed some walking shoe this time. These did not disappoint me.

customer_reviews.text: Just bought my 3rd pair, sole is thick enough for me to use them for 12-16 months, I wear the outsides pretty badly. Wish Brown was still available color though.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing comfort, weight, Horrible squeaky
customer_reviews.text: This shoes are amazing, one of the best I have. I am big guy and they fit comfortable, no pain. I use ortopedics and they squeak a lot (I tried all remedies, talcum powder, etc. Nothing stop the noise), the sole has a squeaky noise too. So, I am twice squeaky ;) If you weight comfort vs noise, comfort wins all the time. If you can pass the noise, then go for them.
customer_reviews.author: Tad Sampson

customer_reviews.text: they fit awesome just needed a 9 instead, price is why I did not get.

customer_reviews.text: I'm a regular user of Saucony shoes, and needed a more dressy pair, and these are close enough for that purpose, and yet still comfortable enough to walk for miles.

customer_reviews.text: Perfect shoe for all the walking I do at work. Should have looked at Saucony a long time ago, since I use their products for running.

customer_reviews.text: Started a running regimen last year. Bought Running shoes from Saucony and loved them. When it came time for a new pair of walking shoes I decided to try the Saucony Echelon instead of my usual Rockports. I am really happy with my purchase. They fit great and are very comfortable even on long walks.

customer_reviews.text: I already have this same shoe in white. I would practically swear this black version (exact same shoe and size) is a touch smaller than the white. I am wearing all day, but after a short while, it is not as comfortable. Really feels a touch tighter overall than my white pair. The white pair is perfect and great! There is no way for me to know if in fact there is truly a difference in the manufacture of the shoe making is feel this way, I can only go by the way it fits and feels. Still an excellent made shoe, and provides good support, which is why I have stayed with this brand and style.

customer_reviews.text: I use this shoe for work where I walk 12-15 miles on an average day. It is easily the most comfortable shoe I have used. It has already given me 6 months of wear and has lasted well although the sole is showing signs of wear. (That's expected after an estimated 1,500+ miles) I recently ordered a new pair and I regularly recommend this shoe to friends and family who are on their feet at work.
customer_reviews.author: T. Emerson Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Saucony Shoe review
customer_reviews.text: Just got these and use with orthotics so time will tell if they are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: MikeG.

customer_reviews.title: The shoes fit great but after only less than 2 months of wearing ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoes fit great but after only less than 2 months of wearing them the soles are starting to separate!
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered size 12 USA. That same size as ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered size 12 USA. That same size as all my walking shoes for the last 10 years. These shoes were too small. I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: W. Shrader

product_meta.title: Saucony Echelon LE2 Men's Hiking Shoes
product_meta.description: Plush tongue and collar. Breathable fabric lining. Molded EVA ComfortLite sockliner cradles the foot, provides arch support and reduces peak pressure in the forefoot. Full-length PowerGridâ" midsole helps center the foot, absorbs impacting shock and redistributes pressure for a smoother, more responsive ride. Dual-density S SLâ" EVA foam enhances rebound and durability at a reduced weight. SRCâ" Impact Zone delivers durable shock absorption in the heel to help reduce torque and promote a smooth transition to the mid-foot. iBR+â" outsole material supplies enhanced cushioning at a weight that is 33% lighter than standard blown rubber. XT-900â" carbon rubber outsole material offers reliable traction and long-lasting wear. Imported.
feature_bullets: Made from super-plush, Garment full-grain leather
Features our premium PowerGrid cushioning system to maximize support and comfort
The 8mm heel-to-toe offset offers a more stable balanced platform
